intro: Kohautia gracilis, commonly known as the slender kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and delicate, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It is a perennial herb that often forms dense mats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
